result.execSummary:
The defendant Zofia Byrigel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court allows transfer of probation to State of Illinois

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or combination thereof.
No contact with victims; The Trek Store (Wausau) and Michaels Craft Store (Wausau).

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. Complete Corrective/Criminal Thinking class.  
*AMENDED: Corrected date of birth to September 23, 1966.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 918am
State appears by ADA L.Gramer.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Aaron Schenk ; Interpreter Iwona Srienc sworn to interpret for defendant if/when requested during this hearing.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

Atty Schenk notes that defendant speaks/understands English fairly well, but has requested interpreter in the event that she has questions; Therefore it will not be necessary for interpreter to interpret entire hearing, only when defendant requests.
State moves to:
Ct. 2 (Felony Retail Theft/PTAC)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (Felony Retail Theft/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 2 years Probation
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Complete Corrective/Criminal Thinking class; N/C w/victims the Trek Store in Wausau and Michaels craft store in Wausau; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; CC including DNA surcharge; DNA sample.

>>COURT allows for transfer of probation to State of IL
>>15 days credit in any event of revocation.

Adj: 9:35am
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:26 a.m. 
Interpreter Iwona Srienic sworn and interprets.   
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody with Attorney Aaron Schenk.
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be filed by the end of today. Attorney Schenk states defendant is ready to proceed with Arraignment. Reading Waived. 
Plea: NOT GUILTY 
PTC- 03/31/15 at 10:00 a.m. in Br.1 office. 
Bond is continued. 
Defendant's last name is BYRIGEL. 
CC- 03/16/15 at 1:00 p.m. in Br.1 office. 
Adj: 10:31 a.m. 
C: Br.1

Preliminary Hearing on March 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered $25,000.00 cash on 3-5-15
Original warrant returned from Sheriff's Dept.

No contact with victim(s): Trek Store, Michaels-Rib Mt., & co-defendant(s): W.N. & T.G. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
